result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Skill, Fees, and Equilibrium AUM ** A manager can generate **α = 2.1%** per year up to **$366m** of capital; above that, incremental α ≈ 0. The fund charges **0.6%** on total AUM. Assume investors flock in until **net α = 0**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Equilibrium AUM
Dollar alpha at capacity: α × capacity = 2.1% × $366m = $7.69m per year.
At equilibrium, investors add capital until **dollar α = fees**:
fee × AUM = 0.6% × AUM = $7.69m ⇒ AUM = $1281m (rounded).
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Fee revenue at equilibrium
Fee revenue = fee × AUM = 0.6% × $1281m = $7.69m per year.
Notice this equals the manager’s **dollar α at capacity**: $7.69m. Intuition: competition drives **net α to investors ≈ 0**; skilled managers capture the rents via fees.
::: :::
